p: Besides, other records have documented the use of Euphorbia species in the treatment of inflammation associated with the digestive system, such as dysentery as well as respiratory system illness, genitourinary inflammation, and sensory systems disorders [ 21]. Decoctions of leaves of related families like Lamiaceae and Asteraceae are also used to treat respiratory system illness like common colds [ 22]. Again E. hirta was reported as the most used species in managing these infections [ 19, 23]. The use of E. hirta is prehistorical as it was used for the treatment of respiratory diseases like bronchitis by Nicander, a Greek physician in the 2nd century before Christ (BC) and has also been described for the same usage in Australia, Hawaii [ 23], and South-western USA.
